abstract: Stewart Parnell, former president of Peanut Corporation of America, is sentenced to 28 years in prison for his involvement in salmonella outbreak that led to deaths of nine people and sickened over 700 others.
lead_paragraph: The former president of a peanut company was sentenced to 28 years in prison for his role in a salmonella outbreak that killed nine people.

headline.main: Georgia: 28-Year Sentence in Tainted Peanut Case
headline.print_headline: Georgia: 28-Year Sentence in Tainted Peanut Case

snippet: The former president of a peanut company was sentenced to 28 years in prison for his role in a salmonella outbreak that killed nine people.
